definition: hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master
to approach/to rise high/thick ice/to insult or maltreat

sentences.english: Friends said that she had been a victim of cyber-bullying.
sentences.chinese: 朋友說，她是網路霸凌的受害者。

sentences.english: The reality, however, is that bullying is not harmless and it must not be ignored.
sentences.chinese: 然而，事實上，霸凌決非無害，且決不可忽視。

sentences.english: Holly was forced to move schools after the bullying became unbearable.
sentences.chinese: 當這些霸凌變得令人無法忍受後，迫使荷莉換學校。

sentences.english: I think calling people fat nerds is a type of bullying.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲叫別人肥宅是一種霸凌。

sentences.english: The authority should adopt strong methods to suppress on-campus and off-campus bullying.
sentences.chinese: 當局應該採取強硬手段遏止校內外霸凌事件。

sentences.english: Schools should give out explicit guidelines on how to avoid cyber bullying.
sentences.chinese: 學校應該給出明確的說明指南關於如何避免網絡霸凌。

sentences.english: People around the world are bullied by American youngsters.
sentences.chinese: 來自全世界各地的人們都被美國青少年霸凌。

definition: domestic violence/abbr. for 家庭暴力[jia1 ting2 bao4 li4]
